Recipe.title: Creamy Soft Toffee
Recipe.Description: When Ransom was growing up, his family used to visit Canada every few years. One of Ransom's favorite treats up there was " MacIntosh's Creamy Toffee". Ransom tried many recipes to duplicate it and finally came up with this.

section.instruction: Lightly spray a 10&inch; &by; 15&inch; cookie sheet with non-stick spray.
In a LARGE, non-stick pot, combine all ingredients except Vanilla.
Heat mixture on high, using a candy thermometer to monitor temperature.

Stirring very frequently, heat to 253° F.
(I know 253° sounds weird, but 250° leaves it runny, and 255° makes it brittle.)
When it reaches temperature, immediately remove the pot from the heat.
Pour mixture onto the prepared cookie sheet and spread evenly.

Notes.note: Warning! Mixture will more than double while heating, then will reduce as it nears the correct temperature, so make sure you use a Large non-stick pot.

Cutting it up is a challenge. At first, I used a hot, large, sharp, chopping knife, and was able to get it if I was patient.
Then I found if you waited until was nearly cool you can use a Pizza Cutter to do the primary cutting.
NOTE: If you leave the edges touching, they will merge back together.
